Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham scored a last-minute equaliser for England to secure a 2-2 draw against Belgium.
Kobbie Mainoo made his first start for England at just 18 years old and delivered an impressive performance.
Ivan Toney scored his first goal for England from the penalty spot.
Youri Tielemans scored twice for Belgium, including a header from a Romelu Lukaku cross.
Jordan Pickford made a crucial save to deny Jeremy Doku.
Joe Gomez replaced John Stones early in the match due to an injury.
Phil Foden missed a significant chance to equalize for England.
England's defensive frailties were highlighted as a concern despite their dominant performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate emphasized the importance of giving opportunities to new players due to numerous injuries in the squad.
Declan Rice was set to captain England for his 50th cap.
Kobbie Mainoo and Ivan Toney were highlighted as key players to watch in the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate will be pleased with the individual performances of Ivan Toney and Kobbie Mainoo.
The match highlighted England's defensive issues despite their overall dominance.
Jude Bellingham's maturity and importance to the team were emphasized after his last-minute goal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wembley Stadium.
England's new away strip was worn for the first time in this match.
The match was dedicated to Alzheimer's Society, with England players wearing nameless shirts in the second half to raise awareness.
